market_position.description: Amazon continues to enhance its market leadership across e-commerce, cloud computing, digital streaming, and other innovative sectors.
initiatives: Delivered a record-breaking holiday season with nearly half a billion items purchased from small businesses.
Enhanced Same-Day Delivery speed, with nearly 26 million customers using the service in the quarter, a 50% increase compared to last year.

Expanded U.S. online store selection with new marquee beauty, home, and fashion brands, including Lancôme, Shiseido, World of Martha by Martha Stewart, Rent the Runway, KNOW Beauty by Vanessa Hudgens, and new The Drop collections from Harlem Fashion Row and Coco & Breezy.
Launched a new Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) capacity management system to help sellers manage inventory and capacity efficiently.
Released the third annual Brand Protection Report, highlighting efforts to combat counterfeit products, resulting in over 6 million counterfeit products seized.
Launched Reviews from Amazon, enabling Buy with Prime merchants to display Amazon.com customer ratings and reviews within their own online stores.
Acquired One Medical, a primary care organization offering both 24/7 virtual care services and in-office visits across the U.S.
Announced that Prime Video will exclusively present the first-ever “Black Friday” National Football League game on November 24.
Set box-office records with MGM’s premiere of Creed III, grossing $100.4 million globally in its opening weekend.
Premiered Amazon Original limited series Daisy Jones & The Six, which debuted at No. 1 on Prime Video globally, along with other original films and series.
Won four Ambies, the premier podcasting award, for Amazon Music and Wondery podcasts.

Announced new commitments and migrations from AWS customers, including partnerships with Southwest Airlines, Zurich Insurance Group, BBVA, Broadridge, S&P Global, Snowflake, Stripe, Westpac, T-Mobile, Marvell, TELUS, and Iberdrola.
Expanded AWS infrastructure footprint with new Regions in Malaysia and Australia.
Launched AWS Regions in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and Mexico, with plans to invest over $10 billion in new data center complexes and infrastructure.
Introduced new generative AI features and partnerships, enhancing AWS’s AI capabilities and expanding its use across various industries.
